title: Zanab247
author: Zanab247
content: We all no that BTC and crypto is illegal in our country, but d government came too late to stop us not to have access to BTC or crypto in d land, and many youths in d country has discovered so many positive things that can help d government to reduce unemployment and also reduce bank stress in the country, if dey will allow BTC or crypto users in  some political office. Like what I was told about Nigerian politics, anyone that have huge amount of money and influence always have a good chance to win any political office in Nigeria. but BTC and crypto users have the money or influence for some local political office like councilor position, chairman position, state political office like governor, house of assembly, and federal political office like president, senator and house of representatives, my question is this, can BTC or crypto users play politics in Nigeria by coming out for councilor or other political office and he or she is well know as BTC or crypto users? I see some of our crypto and BTC users here, and dey have the knowledge to function in some political office if such opportunity is be offer or aquire by money or influence. What is your opinion.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: Zanab247 on June 27, 2023, 07:46:05 PMWe all no that BTC and crypto is illegal in our country, but d government came too late to stop us not to have access to BTC or crypto in d landBitcoin and other cryptocurrencies are not banned by our government, only CBN ban cryptocurrencies.As time goes on, there will definitely be some crypto users that would hold public offices in Nigeria. Everything will happen naturally like evolution.

comments.author: Hyphen(-)
comments.body: For now, since CBN has tagged Bitcoin and Cryptocurrency activities as illegal, we have no choice but to wait for Federal government considerations since the current president promised us good news about Bitcoin and blockchain technology during his campaign, but if he does as others have done by failing his promises, then that’s when the youth will plan on taking some positions because I am sure we have youths here that love politics.Taking some lower positions in politics will not be enough to change any process or bring in Bitcoin, but it will surely increase the awareness and the adoption in our locality.

Like what I was told about Nigerian politics, anyone that have huge amount of money and influence always have a good chance to win any political office in Nigeria. but BTC and crypto users have the money or influence for some local political office like councilor position, chairman position, state political office like governor, house of assembly, and federal political office like president, senator and house of representatives, my question is this, can BTC or crypto users play politics in Nigeria by coming out for councilor or other political office and he or she is well know as BTC or crypto users? I see some of our crypto and BTC users here, and dey have the knowledge to function in some political office if such opportunity is be offer or aquire by money or influence. What is your opinion. Btc might be illegal in our country like you said but that shouldn't stop crypto users to participate in politics or aspire for political positions, contesting for a position is a thing of choice and no true citizen is deprived of such so far you meet up the requirements for such position and have the  support and funds to pursue your aspiration. However there are many crypto whales capable of challenging most of the high ranking politicians for their office and money won't be an issues to them cause the have lots of funds stored in cryptocurrencies.  However asides from the high level of corruption in our government Nigeria @ 62 have gone beyond that stage where politician with greater wealth stand a high chance of winning, we've failed to practice the Democratic system of government of the people for the peope and by the people and gone to a point where democracy is now for the rich alone where, the rich use their wealth to pay and bribe their way into government positions just to loot the nations treasury and make themselves richer, a time shall come when the sons of a nobody would become somebody and hold high positions in the government sector, that's what we all hope for, only time will tell.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: Do you want to go nd announce to di public dat you have enough Bitcoins so let dem elect you as their leader? Bitcoin dey anonymity so it users e dey anonymity. And dis won wey una dey sae Bitcoin and it crypto world e dey illogical in country sef me I never understand am oo. Dis matter we don talk here for plenty times but now sef, some people never know how e bi concerning Bitcoin in we country. Is Cryptocurrency e dey illogical in Nigeria? Me I no no make piple wey been dey use Bitcoin before banks stopped the use of Bitcoin from their service come and tok something. If crypto e dey illogical in di country y we dey use freely without any form threat. Abi na me never know saw e dey illogical? Op di people wey e no no or e no dey use crypto e many pass piple wey dey use am so e no go fit influence di crowds. But when convert am to money then u come use the money campaign den u go fit win di election and introduce Bitcoin in your administration. If you tell some people sae you go give Dem Bitcoin if Dem vote for you, Dem no go mind you oo, instead Dem go vote for your opponent wey go give am naira note. So removed Bitcoin from Nigeria politics for now. But you can only sae u go adopt Bitcoin in you jurisdiction.

D place I dey for Naija, if EFCC or police see BTC or crypto in your wallet u will regret why u come show yourself in that area because, they will tell u if u don't know that government has banned BTC and crypto in the country, because if it is legal in Nigeria EFCC and police will not arrest u.Quote If you tell some people sae you go give Dem Bitcoin if Dem vote for you, Dem no go mind you oo, instead Dem go vote for your opponent wey go give am naira note. comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: Crypto/Bitcoin no dey illegal for Nigeria, e no get when our government ban crypto, the only thing wey dem do be say you no go fit buy crypto directly on exchanges through your Nigerian bank, but wahala no dey because ever since them implement am, Nigerians come dey buy crypto wella through peer to peer.Back to your topic so, wetin make you feel say some Nigerians wey hold political positions no dey into crypto, dem no go come tell you na, though e go make sense if Naija go get politicians wey go dey openly in support of Bitcoin and crypto, e go fit help to dey attract policies wey go favor crypto growth and adoption.

comments.author: Cryptomultiplier
comments.body: Politics for we country na dirty game, abi you no know?It might not be shedding blood persay as you might think, it could be digging up dirt concerning ones source of income, scrutiny into your investments and all else. Users can play, but it might be questionable if you declare it is from crypto currency you earn. No matter how much crypto is justified in the eyes of many who understand it, your reputation from colleagues who have had dealings with you or worked with you at some point, will attest more to and be a contributing factor to your political success, not whether you use crypto or not.One among the tenets of governance is to ensure that the cultural aspect and principles of our fore fathers as regards means of livelihood, standards to meet before belonging to a political party, will always require that one must have contributed to the growth of society by working and earning,  among others.

Can you please give us the source to that update let us know.Quote from: Zanab247 on June 27, 2023, 07:46:05 PM Like what I was told about Nigerian politics, anyone that have huge amount of money and influence always have a good chance to win any political office in Nigeria. but BTC and crypto users have the money or influence for some local political office like councilor position, chairman position, state political office like governor, house of assembly, and federal political office like president, senator and house of representatives, my question is this, can BTC or crypto users play politics in Nigeria by coming out for councilor or other political office and he or she is well know as BTC or crypto users? What is your opinion.For sure Nigeria politics is all about who get the funds to push for electioneering process and not about the character of individual that is why we find ourselves were we are today. I am not surprised that our politicians are fully into crypto but are not coming forth to say it publicly and this might be the reasons why they kicked against anything that would attack the existence of bitcoin in Nigeria. So far there are many crypto enthusiast in politics, some are even sponsors while some are contestant, some are appointees, etc depending on how the connect is.In essence, as a smart Nigerian, you have to play safe and be on low keys although btc is not illegal in Nigeria but the ignorant agencies are out to get their own share of the cake without minding the law. Wisdom is profitable to direct.

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: There is no law stopping politicians from being involved in cryptocurrency.  As a matter of fact, many of them are actively involved in cryptocurrency.  I wouldn't be surprised if crypto is one of their means of hiding funds.During the time former president Buhari banned Twitter, the then Minister of Justice, Abubakar Malami deactivated his Twitter account and shared the screenshot. Unfortunately for him, people noticed he uses Latoken exchange... as captured in this article : https://www.lindaikejisblog.com/2021/6/reno-omokri-calls-out-agf-abubakar-malami-alleges-cryptocurrency-trading-and-use-of-vpn-which-is-banned-in-the-country.html .So, obviously, many top ranking politicians uses crypto and there is no law against them.

comments.author: uchegod-21
comments.body: Quote from: Zanab247 on June 27, 2023, 07:46:05 PMmy question is this, can BTC or crypto users play politics in Nigeria by coming out for councilor or other political office and he or she is well know as BTC or crypto users?Bitcoin users are not higher or lesser citizens in Nigeria and there is no where anyone aspiring to fit into any of the positions you listed above will declare whether they save their money or use fiat or Bitcoin. In the other hand, Bitcoin dealers do not go around boasting that they are Bitcoin dealers. How then will you be able to identify who is a Bitcoin user or not.Meanwhile, the Federal government has not banned Bitcoin usage in Nigeria, it is only the central bank that prohibits it's transactions with banks. That is the situation and not outright ban.
